text: 14.164 Shopfronts should incorporate a well-defined frame, including location of signage, stall-riser, door and window units which sit in a defined architectural surround, use appropriate high quality, sustainable materials and be of a scale which relates to the upper floors of the building and complements the quality and character of surrounding buildings. 14.165 Achieving a sensitive relationship between the shopfront and its surroundings means, for instance, that shopfront fascias should be within the width of a single building and should not extend above the ground floor or obscure architectural features of value. On a historic building, the fascia sign height shall be dictated by any prevailing original pilaster detailing.
